author: EXM7777
text:
the biggest AI bottleneck right now is memory...

think about it:
> you open your LLM
> you have to re-explain your context every time
> or spend 30 minutes setting up a project
> or hope the built-in memory actually works (it doesn't)

and this is the current state of the market...

- chatgpt has a terrible approach
- claude is better but slow
- gemini might have a good shot at it, waiting to see if they crack this

the best workaround right now are memory MCPs with connected knowledge bases

but it's still external... still manual... still friction

the real breakthrough comes when:

i open my LLM, i prompt naturally and it just knows my context without me thinking about it

that's when it'll feel like we actually have next-level intelligence
